events.message: Customer reported a vehicle collision that occurred on April 30th, involving their car and another vehicle at an intersection.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident due to the mention of car collision and damages reported.
An insurance agent was assigned to assist the claimant with the process and provide guidance throughout the claim lifecycle.
The insurance company acknowledged receipt of the claim and confirmed that it is now being processed in their system.
Requested submission of police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and driver’s license copy to proceed with investigation.
Customer provided all requested documents including the police report, photographs of the damaged car, and identification proof.
A claims investigator was assigned and began reviewing submitted evidence and reports related to the accident.
The investigation concluded confirming fault and assessing the extent of the vehicle damage and liability.
A settlement offer was proposed based on the damage assessment and policy coverage terms communicated to the customer.
Customer responded positively appreciating the quick communication and transparent settlement offer.
The claim was formally approved by the underwriting team after final review of all documentation and investigation results.
Payment for the approved settlement amount was successfully issued to the customer’s bank account.
The claim was officially closed following payment issuance and confirmation that all obligations were fulfilled.
The case file was archived in the insurance records for future reference and compliance purposes.
